title: Create the Gapminder dataset
text:
# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
from gapminder import gapminder

# Rename 'lifeExp' to 'life_expectancy' and 'gdpPercap' to 'gdp_per_capita'
gapminder = gapminder.rename(columns={'lifeExp': 'life_expectancy',
                                      'pop': 'population_millions', 
                                      'gdpPercap': 'gdp_per_capita'})

# Convert population to millions
gapminder['population_millions'] = gapminder['population_millions'] / 1_000_000

# Create a new pandas DataFrame from the modified gapminder data
gapminder_df = pd.DataFrame(gapminder)

# Save the DataFrame as a CSV file
gapminder_df.to_csv('gapminder.csv', index=False)

# Print the first 3 rows of the DataFrame
print(gapminder_df.head(3))

title: Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
text:
This page explores the relationship between life expectancy and GDP per capita across countries over time.

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

gap = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")

years = sorted(gap["year"].unique())
fig, axes = plt.subplots(3, 4, figsize=(14, 9), constrained_layout=True)
axes = axes.flatten()

for i, yr in enumerate(years):
    ax = axes[i]
    d = gap[gap["year"] == yr]
    ax.scatter(d["gdp_per_capita"], d["life_expectancy"], alpha=0.6)
    ax.set_xscale("log")
    ax.set_title(str(yr))
    ax.set_xlabel("GDP per Capita (log scale)")
    ax.set_ylabel("Life Expectancy (years)")

plt.show()

title: Country Analysis
text:
This page analyzes how life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population change over time for one country.

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

gap = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")

country_name = "China"  # change this to any country in the dataset
c = gap[gap["country"] == country_name].sort_values("year")

fig, axes = plt.subplots(3, 1, figsize=(10, 10), constrained_layout=True)

# Life expectancy
axes[0].plot(c["year"], c["life_expectancy"], marker="o")
axes[0].set_title(f"{country_name}: Life Expectancy Over Time")
axes[0].set_xlabel("Year")
axes[0].set_ylabel("Life Expectancy (years)")

# GDP per capita
axes[1].plot(c["year"], c["gdp_per_capita"], marker="o")
axes[1].set_yscale("log")
axes[1].set_title(f"{country_name}: GDP per Capita Over Time")
axes[1].set_xlabel("Year")
axes[1].set_ylabel("GDP per Capita (log scale)")

# Population
axes[2].plot(c["year"], c["population_millions"], marker="o")
axes[2].set_title(f"{country_name}: Population Over Time")
axes[2].set_xlabel("Year")
axes[2].set_ylabel("Population (millions)")

plt.show()

title: Life Expectancy and Population
text:
This page explores the relationship between life expectancy and population across countries.

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

gap = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")

plt.figure(figsize=(9, 6))
plt.scatter(gap["population_millions"], gap["life_expectancy"], alpha=0.6)
plt.xscale("log")
plt.xlabel("Population (millions, log scale)")
plt.ylabel("Life Expectancy (years)")
plt.title("Life Expectancy vs Population")
plt.show()
